en: When two armies oppose one another, those who can fight should fight, those who can't fight should guard, those who can't guard should flee, those who can't flee should surrender, and those who can't surrender should die.
zh: 两军对垒时，能打的就打，不能打的就守，不能守的就逃，不能逃的就投降，不能投降的就死。

en: Look! The train has arrived!
I can't remember.
I don't remember.
We drank shochu at the karaoke bar.
Why did you lie?
Myanmar is ruled by a military dictatorship.
The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.
zh: 耶和华是我的牧者，我必不至缺乏。

en: Selena Gomez was named after the Tejano singer Selena.
zh: 赛琳娜·戈麦斯是以特哈诺歌手赛琳娜的名字命名的。

en: In 2009, Selena Gomez became the youngest person to be named a United Nations Children's Fund Ambassador in the United States.
zh: 2009年，赛琳娜·戈麦斯成了美国最年轻的联合国儿童基金会大使。

en: For how long have you been studying Esperanto?
zh: 你学世界语学了多久了？

en: All the sweet talk was just a ruse to get her into bed.
zh: 那些甜言蜜语不过是想骗她上床的把戏。

en: The book was published in 1689.
In the U.S., they often mistake me for a Chinese person.
zh: 在美国，他们常把我当成中国人。

en: It is very interesting to learn Esperanto.
Bananas are yellow.
The dog is smart.
Dogs are smart.
Satoru is the fastest runner out of the five of us.
zh: 悟是我们五个人里跑得最快的。

en: The Shinanogawa river is the longest river in Japan.
zh: 信浓川是日本最长的河流。

en: What is the tallest mountain in Europe?
What's the tallest mountain in Europe?
Takada is the richest out of all of us.
zh: 高田是我们所有人里最有钱的。

en: Miho plays the piano better than Noriko.
zh: 美穗钢琴弹得比典子好。

en: Miho plays piano better than Noriko.
zh: 美穗弹钢琴比典子弹得好。

en: The sunset is soon.
It'll soon be sunset.
The sun will soon set.
Did you eat lunch?
Has your father arrived yet?
After that, I'll leave for Saigon.
zh: 在那之后，我就出发去西贡。

en: I'm flying to Hanoi tomorrow.
The moon is pretty in the fall.
Some programmers seem to forget that writing good documentation is as important, if not more important, as writing a good program.
zh: 有些程序员好像忘了，写好文档和写好程序一样重要，甚至更重要。

en: How much is a beer?
Wipe your tears.
London is their second home.
zh: 伦敦是他们的第二个家。

en: Everyone is entitled to all the rights and freedoms set forth in this Declaration, without distinction of any kind, such as race, colour, sex, language, religion, political or other opinion, national or social origin, property, birth or other status.
zh: 人人有权享有本宣言所载的一切权利和自由，不分种族、肤色、性别、语言、宗教、政见或其他见解、国籍或社会出身、财产、出生或其他身份等任何区别。

en: Furthermore, no distinction shall be made on the basis of the political, jurisdictional or international status of the country or territory to which a person belongs, whether it be independent, trust, non-self-governing or under any other limitation of sovereignty.
zh: 此外，也不得因一人所属的国家或领土的政治、行政或国际地位的不同而有所区别，无论该领土是独立的、托管的、非自治的，还是处于其他主权受限的情况。

en: Everyone has the right to life, liberty and the security of person.
zh: 人人有权享有生命、自由和人身安全。

en: No one shall be subjected to torture or to cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment.
zh: 任何人不得被处以酷刑，或受残忍、不人道或侮辱性的待遇或惩罚。

en: My daughter caught a cold.
How did you learn about that news?
zh: 你是怎么知道那个消息的？

en: I want to visit Korea.
I want to visit South Korea.
That book is thick, but it's not very expensive.
zh: 那本书挺厚的，但不怎么贵。

en: His birthday is May 5th.
I wonder what I should get you for your birthday.
zh: 我在想你生日送你什么好。

en: Man plans things, but the gods decide.
My coworker really knows how to suck up to the boss.
zh: 我那个同事真会拍老板马屁。

en: When did you come back from London?
zh: 你什么时候从伦敦回来的？

en: They speak English in Australia.
He took a book from the bookshelf.
zh: 他从书架上拿了一本书。

en: Ask only "yes" or "no" questions.
What is this bird called?
Italian is my mother tongue.
Shit, I blew a fuse!
Wise men talk about ideas, intellectuals about facts, and the ordinary man talks about what he eats.
zh: 智者谈论思想，知识分子谈论事实，普通人谈论饮食。

en: This is my sister.
Why did you decide to affiliate yourself with Company A?
zh: 你当初为什么决定加入A公司？

en: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
zh: 那只敏捷的棕色狐狸跳过了一只懒狗。

en: I love to hear a grandfather clock chime.
zh: 我喜欢听落地钟报时的声音。

en: I've tried calling him all day, but the line is busy.
zh: 我打了他一天的电话，但一直占线。

en: Please do not forget.
This is a car.
I write everything down; I feel uneasy without my notebook.
zh: 我什么都记下来，没带笔记本我就觉得不踏实。

en: I have time, so I'll do it.
I've been thinking about it the entire day.
Good people can be found anywhere.
He threw everything out of the boat.
zh: 他把船里的东西全扔出去了。

en: Look at what she brought for my birthday party!
zh: 看她给我生日派对带了什么！

en: I prefer milk to juice.
zh: 比起果汁，我更喜欢喝牛奶。

en: I'm dubious about claims to speak more than five languages fluently.
zh: 我很怀疑有人能流利地说五种以上的语言。

en: The wedding will be held in a 17th century church.
zh: 婚礼会坐落在一座17世纪的教堂里举行。

en: Your shoes are untied.
I got a piece of lead for my mechanical pencil from her.
zh: 我从她那儿拿了一根自动笔芯。

en: A child of just five was hit by a bicycle.
zh: 一个才五岁的孩子被自行车撞了。

en: At that time, bicycles were just starting to get popular and, here and there, there were many unskilled beginners who ran into people and broke through their hedges.
zh: 那时候自行车刚开始流行，到处都是技术不精的新手，经常撞到人或者冲进别人家的树篱。

en: I'm back.
The Devil made me do it.
A long time ago, around here, a nice schoolteacher called Matsumoto tried to rescue one of his pupils, but on the contrary he ended up drowning.
zh: 很久以前，这儿有个叫松本的好老师，为了救学生结果自己淹死了。

en: The locals call this river the man-eating river and fear it.
zh: 当地人管这条河叫“食人河”，都很怕它。

en: Don't make promises that you cannot keep.
zh: 做不到的事就别乱答应。

en: Today Maral became one year old.
Coming to school in your pajamas, how lazy!
zh: 穿着睡衣来上学，你也太懒了吧！

en: The plane arrived exactly at nine.
It seems that Ali is very interested in Myrmecology.
zh: 阿里好像对蚂蚁学挺感兴趣的。

en: It's a peacock. It was a peacock that cried just now.
zh: 是孔雀。刚才叫唤的是只孔雀。

en: Yikes!
I'm wondering what will happen if I push this button.
zh: 我在想如果我按了这个按钮会发生什么。

en: I once saw a man walk barefoot over hot coals.
zh: 我曾经见过一个人光着脚走过通红的炭火。

en: This algorithm doesn't converge.
Kiss me.
Young man, enjoy yourself while you are young!
zh: 年轻人，趁年轻好好享受生活吧！

en: Time is money.
I couldn't find the page I was looking for.
zh: 我没找到我想找的那个页面。

en: We were unable to find the webpage that you requested.
zh: 我们没能找到您请求的网页。

en: We are the people.
This is the cheapest shop in town.
zh: 这是镇上最便宜的一家店。

en: My name is Sasha.
I am a student in a university.
You've got dark circles under your eyes.
You've got bags under your eyes.
Please introduce yourself, sir. What's your profession?
zh: 先生，请介绍一下你自己。你是做什么工作的？

en: Welcome to the Tatoeba Project website.
zh: 欢迎来到 Tatoeba 项目网站。

en: Welcome to Tatoeba!
You can add sentences that you do not know how to translate. Perhaps someone else will know.
zh: 你可以添加一些你不知道怎么翻译的句子，也许别人会知道。

en: Do you like white chocolate?
High calorie foods are bad for my health.
zh: 高热量的食物对健康没好处。

en: There are about seven billion people in the world.
Masha didn't know her parents.
There are more important things in life.
zh: 生活中还有更重要的事。

en: Long live the Emperor!
How many friends do you have?
How are things at work?
Do you have plans for tonight?
What are you doing right now?
I'm glad to have been invited to dinner.
zh: 很高兴被邀请来吃晚饭。

en: She's wearing a hat.
Some people do not have a consistent set of principles; they just adopt whatever principles benefit them at the moment.
zh: 有些人没什么原则，总是怎么对自己有利就怎么来。

en: There remain approximately 900 art sketches by Leonardo da Vinci.
zh: 达芬奇留下的艺术草图大约还有900幅。

en: Each person paid $7,000.
She wore her hair in plaits.
The English language is undoubtedly the easiest and at the same time the most efficient means of international communication.
zh: 英语无疑是国际交流中最简单、同时也最高效的工具。

en: He passed away yesterday.
He deceased yesterday.
He passed on yesterday.
How do you say 'a cat' in Hebrew?
My dream is to go to Japan someday.
zh: 我的梦想是有一天能去趟日本。

en: Today I'm lacking inspiration.
He grabbed her hand.
Spring will be here soon.

When I was very young, my father died. His younger brother, due to the vicissitudes of the times and to his own laziness, dissipated his own fortune and afterwards became a peddler of writing materials. He often came to our house, but when he came, my mother would scold him and he would be troubled.
zh: 我很小的时候父亲就去世了。他的弟弟，因为时局变迁加上自己又懒，把家产都败光了，后来成了个卖文具的小贩。他经常来我家，但他一来我妈就数落他，弄得他挺难堪的。

en: I don't remember having had any toys when I was young.
zh: 我不记得小时候玩过什么玩具。

en: Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn.
zh: 坦白说，亲爱的，我一点也不在乎。

en: In elementary school, I was a prodigy and I was mostly the first or second best student in my class.
zh: 我上小学那会儿可是个神童，成绩经常是班里数一数二的。

en: When I think about it now, our family lived a very miserable life.
zh: 现在想想，我们家那时候过得挺惨的。

en: I said that I don't remember having had any toys, and I also don't remember having had any snacks.
zh: 我说过我不记得玩过什么玩具，也不记得吃过什么零食。

en: I had no toys or anything else, so I used a chalk that had been bought for me and drew pictures and letters on a closet door.
zh: 我没有什么玩具，所以我就用给我买的粉笔在柜门上画画写字。

en: I see dead people.
My wife gave birth to a child when we were very poor. While she was sleeping, I cooked rice and vegetables for several days and surprised her with the variety and taste of my cooking.
zh: 我们那时候穷得叮当响，我老婆生了孩子。趁她睡觉的时候，我连着做了好几天的饭菜，花样和味道都让她吃了一惊。

en: I had resolved to steal one yen to go see it, but we were poor and there was no way I would find one yen to steal around our house.
zh: 我曾下定决心要偷一块钱去看看，但家里太穷了，根本翻不出一块钱来让我偷。

en: When I was in elementary school I thought, from the bottom of my heart, that the teachers were great people and I was influenced by the teachers' attitudes and moral lessons, but middle school was just a business like any other.
zh: 我上小学的时候，打心底里觉得老师们都很伟大，深受他们言行和品德教育的影响，但中学不过就是一门生意。

en: Once, when I went to my friend Kawai's house, he fired a pistol. He thought it was not loaded and pointed it at my mouth, but it was and the bullet grazed my ear before hitting the closet.
zh: 有一次去我朋友河合家，他开了一枪。他以为枪里没装子弹，就对着我的嘴瞄准，结果枪里有子弹，子弹擦着我的耳朵飞过去，打中了柜子。

en: I wanted to become a philosopher.
It's a lot easier to fall in love than to stay in love.
zh: 坠入爱河容易，守住爱情难。

en: Wait, don't shoot!
A cat abhors a vacuum.
Cats hate vacuum cleaners.
It's nice out today, and will be tomorrow as well.
zh: 今天天气不错，明天也会挺好的。

en: It was a terrible affair.
I hate Mondays.

Me and my colleagues lived in a small 2 room cabin built on the edge of a cliff on the mountain. I say 2 rooms, but besides the entrance, there was a 6 by 2 tatami room. We ate potatoes, dried fish and tofu. Because we were on the top of a cold mountain, the potatoes would freeze during the winter.
zh: 我和同事住在山崖边的一个两居室小木屋里。说是两居室，其实除了玄关，就是一个六乘二榻榻米大的房间。我们吃土豆、干鱼和豆腐。因为在寒冷的山顶上，土豆在冬天都会冻住。

en: What's done is done.
zh: 过去的事就让它过去吧。

en: Regardless how loud you scream "Oo-oo!", you won't turn into a wolf.
zh: 不管你“嗷呜”叫得有多响，你也变不成狼。

en: He who wounds by the sword, dies by the sword.
zh: 拿起剑杀人的，必死在剑下。

en: Now this is something. What wonderful presents! Boy am I happy!
zh: 哇，太棒了！这么多好礼物！我真是太开心了！

en: In Australia, English is spoken.
Uyghur is a Turkic language.
zh: 维吾尔语是一种突厥语。

en: The train seems to be late.
Every morning, I go shopping.
zh: 我每天早上都去买东西。

en: The story of a great flood is very common in world mythology.
zh: 大洪水的故事在世界神话中非常普遍。

en: Don't be ridiculous!
It's complicated as hell.
"When do you get up?" "At 8 in the morning."
It's dangerous to talk on the phone and drive at the same time.
zh: 开车的时候打电话很危险。

en: Brilliant people have one major drawback - they don't know how to lose.
zh: 聪明人有一个大缺点——就是输不起。

en: Four times five is 20.
I'm waiting for someone.
I need help.
It's okay if you go in there and take a seat.
She doesn't have a driver's license.
If you're bored, you can contribute to Tatoeba.
zh: 如果你觉得无聊，可以为Tatoeba做点贡献。

en: I want you only when you're not there.
zh: 我只有在你不在的时候才想要你。

en: Do not translate this sentence!
Hell is other people.
Others are hell.
She looks tired.
I'm already full, thank you.
Justin Bieber is more famous than Katie Holmes.
zh: 贾斯汀·比伯比凯蒂·霍尔姆斯更出名。
tokens: 贾斯汀·比伯比凯蒂·霍尔姆斯

en: He works as a translator.
Though he is no longer president, he still holds considerable sway among the political elite.
zh: 虽然他不再是总统了，但在政界精英中仍然很有影响力。

en: Two days ago the wind blew.
The house is cold.
Yesterday snow fell.
A dog that barks all the time doesn't make a good watch dog.
zh: 一直叫个不停的狗当不了好看门狗。

en: When I moved into my new home, I just brought with me the things that I needed for cooking, an earthen rice cooker, an earthenware pot and an earthen charcoal brazier.
zh: 搬进新家时，我只带了些做饭用的东西：一个陶土焖饭锅、一个陶罐和一个陶土炭火炉。

en: We enjoyed watching TV.
"I need some money," Dima said, with a tone of embarrassment.
zh: “我需要点钱，”迪马神色尴尬地说道。

en: I lost this oblong Japanese brazier in an earthquake.
zh: 我在地震中丢了这个长方形的日式火盆。

en: One day, I came back and my wife and one of my friends were inside the kotatsu.
zh: 有一天我回来，发现我老婆和我一个朋友正钻在被炉里。

en: I could not buy the 3 sen stamp to put on the letter, so it ended up staying for many days on top of the tokonoma.
zh: 我买不起贴信用的那张三钱邮票，结果信就在壁龛上搁了好几天。

en: I built up some debts at the rice seller and at the greengrocer.
zh: 我在米店和蔬菜店欠了一些债。

en: It became so that I had to hide from the landlord.
zh: 搞得我最后不得不躲着房东。

en: My wife started to work as a female reporter for the newspaper Yomiuri.
zh: 我妻子开始在《读卖新闻》当女记者了。

en: Sometimes the old landlady would come by and said "That child doesn't cry", but it was that my babysitting was godly.
zh: 有时老房东太太会过来说“那孩子不哭”，其实是因为我带娃带得太神了。

en: When I was inside my mother's womb, I looked through my mother's navel at the house where I would be born and I thought: "No way I'm going there".
zh: 我还在我妈肚子里的时候，透过她的肚脐眼看了一眼我要出生的那个家，然后想：“我才不要去那儿呢。”

en: When I was inside my mother's womb, I looked through my mother's navel at the house where I would be born and I thought: "This won't do".
zh: 我还在我妈肚子里的时候，透过她的肚脐眼看了一眼我要出生的那个家，然后想：“这地方不行啊。”

en: For the peasant, fruits are more important than flowers.
zh: 对农民来说，果实比花更重要。

en: I have one of my friends who graduated from university and became a fine public servant. Once he told me that what he had learned from school had been useless. However, what little philosophy he had learned proved to be of great benefit.
zh: 我有个朋友，大学毕业后当了一名优秀的公务员。他曾跟我说，他在学校学的东西都没用，倒是那点哲学知识后来派上了大用场。

en: This sentence has seven words in it.
This is a sentence that has the syllable count of a haiku.
zh: 这句话的音节数跟俳句一样。

en: This is a sentence that has the syllable count of a good haiku.
zh: 这句话的音节数跟一首好的俳句一样。

en: Hey.
We hold these truths to be self-evident, that all men are created equal . . .
zh: 我们认为这些真理是不言而喻的：人人生而平等……

en: We praise the good old times, but live today.
zh: 我们赞美过去的好时光，但生活在今天。

en: We've lost 3 to 0.
What's the historian's duty?
zh: 历史学家的职责是什么？

en: We're out of stock.
You don't need to wrap it.
It doesn't hurt.
It won't hurt.
I have just returned from the post office.
I'm a 24-year-old American; I go by Steve.
zh: 我是个24岁的美国人，大家都叫我史蒂夫。

en: I lived in Japan for 2 years, but now I'm living in California.
zh: 我在日本住过两年，但现在住在加州。

en: Since I'm planning to go to Japan next year, I'm studying Japanese.
zh: 因为我打算明年去日本，所以现在正在学日语。

en: He was a very handsome boy, he had the face of an angel.
zh: 他是个非常帅气的男孩，长着一张天使般的脸。

en: She turned away from me to hide a tear that had begun to fall down her cheek.
zh: 她转过身去，不想让我看到她流下的眼泪。

en: Butterflies live for three days.
Do you really love me from the bottom of your heart?
zh: 你真的从心底里爱我吗？

en: Then, while saying this, the memories of the men who had seduced her, her husband's colleague who had approached her as if it were a joke, the section chief with whom she had held hands, her relative who she had tried to kiss while she was drunk, shined as if projected upon a broken mirror.
zh: 然后，在说这些话的时候，那些诱惑过她的男人的记忆——那个像开玩笑一样接近她的丈夫同事、那个和她牵过手的科长、那个她喝醉时想亲吻的亲戚——全都像投影在碎镜子上一样闪现了出来。

en: Near the door, an elaborate metal robot -- a robot designed to keep away intruders, was standing coldly.
zh: 门旁边冷冰冰地站着一个精致的金属机器人，是专门用来防范闯入者的。

en: The wife stood up from her chair. She then looked at the door.
zh: 妻子从椅子上站起来，然后看向门口。

en: The woman stood up from the chair and looked towards the door.
zh: 那个女人从椅子上站起来，望向门口。

en: Near the bed, the composite aluminium robot, with a human shape and with a rubber skin, cleverly painted to resemble human skin, glued to its body, was standing naked.
zh: 床边站着一个光溜溜的人形铝合金机器人，它身上贴着一层精心涂漆、真假难辨的橡胶皮肤。

en: It's just like a human. Even the hands of the robot are warm.
zh: 简直跟真人一样，就连机器人的手都是热乎的。

en: There were three buttons on the lower back of the robot.
zh: 机器人的后腰上有三个按钮。

en: "If you stop loving the robot, it will take its revenge upon you" "That robot will--" "Yes" " What type of revenge?" "It will kill you"
zh: “如果你不再爱这个机器人了，它会报复你的。”“那个机器人会……”“对。”“什么样的报复？”“它会杀了你。”

en: It seems that in Japan too, electric taxis will be operated by robots.
zh: 看来在日本，电动出租车也要由机器人来开了。

en: You can make a computer-to-computer call on the internet for free!
zh: 你可以在网上免费打电脑对电脑的通话！

en: The proposed method is applied to three simulated case studies.
zh: 这个方法被应用到了三个模拟案例研究中。

en: Grammatically there is nothing wrong with this sentence, but I think it would never actually be used.
